column1: Turning to our work on interest rate benchmark reform, it is worth recalling that, before the scandal broke,  the London interbank offered rate (L IBOR ) was not regulated.

That is emphatically not the view of the FSB Official Sector Steering Group that I now cochair with Martin , which concluded that it is e ssential to develop one or more risk free (or near risk free) alternatives to L IBOR  for use in financial contracts such as interest rate derivatives.
